Interface SampleRetrofitService

    SAMPLE SERVICE EXAMPLE Created by pmacdowell on 8/25/2016.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      retrofit2.Call<java.lang.Void> deleteUser(java.lang.String authToken, java.lang.String userId)
      This would be a sample of a DELETE request to remove a user from the DB.
      retrofit2.Call<TESTINGPOJO2> getUser(java.lang.String authToken, java.lang.String userId)
      This would be a sample of a post request to a sample get user endpoint that takes in a path string attached to the user id and returns an object of type TESTINGPOJO2
      retrofit2.Call<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TESTINGPOJO2>> getUsers(java.lang.String authToken, java.lang.String userId, java.lang.String fields, java.lang.String sortByName)
      This would be a sample of a post request to a sample get user endpoint that takes in a path string attached to the user id as well as some query variables for fields and returns an object of type TESTINGPOJO2.
      retrofit2.Call<TESTINGPOJO2> login(TESTINGPOJO credentials)
      This would be a sample of a post request to a login endpoint that takes in an object of type TESTINGPOJO for the credentials and then returns an object of type TESTINGPOJO2
      retrofit2.Call<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?>> updateUser(java.lang.String authToken, java.lang.String userId, TESTINGPOJO2 userObject)
      This would be a sample of a PUT request to a sample get user endpoint that takes in a path string attached to the user id as well as a user object (TESTINGPOJO2 object) and returns a map of type String, ?.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        @POST(value="/apiv1/login")
retrofit2.Call<TESTINGPOJO2> login(@Body
                                                                TESTINGPOJO credentials)
        This would be a sample of a post request to a login endpoint that takes in an object of type TESTINGPOJO for the credentials and then returns an object of type TESTINGPOJO2
        Parameters:
        credentials - object of type TESTINGPOJO
        Returns:
        An object of type TESTINGPOJO2 This url request would look like this if printed out: www.baseurl.com/api/v1/login + the headers + the JSON Body of type TESTINGPOJO

      • getUser

        @GET(value="/apiv1/users/{userId}")
retrofit2.Call<TESTINGPOJO2> getUser(@Header(value="AuthToken")
                                                                          java.lang.String authToken,
                                                                          @Path(value="userId")
                                                                          java.lang.String userId)
        This would be a sample of a post request to a sample get user endpoint that takes in a path string attached to the user id and returns an object of type TESTINGPOJO2
        Parameters:
        authToken - Sample auth token
        userId - Sample user id
        Returns:
        Return an object of type TESTINGPOJO2 This url request would look like this if printed out: www.baseurl.com/api/v1/user/USER_ID_HERE + the headers

      • getUsers

        @GET(value="/apiv1/users/{userId}/specifics")
retrofit2.Call<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TESTINGPOJO2>> getUsers(@Header(value="AuthToken")
                                                                                                                     java.lang.String authToken,
                                                                                                                     @Path(value="userId")
                                                                                                                     java.lang.String userId,
                                                                                                                     @Query(value="fields")
                                                                                                                     java.lang.String fields,
                                                                                                                     @Query(value="sortByName")
                                                                                                                     java.lang.String sortByName)
        This would be a sample of a post request to a sample get user endpoint that takes in a path string attached to the user id as well as some query variables for fields and returns an object of type TESTINGPOJO2.
        Parameters:
        authToken - Sample auth token
        userId - Sample user id
        Returns:
        Return an a map of Strings linked to objects of type TESTINGPOJO2. This would be fairly typical if returning an ID to their account user object This url request would look like this if printed out: www.baseurl.com/api/v1/user/USER_ID_HERE/specifics?fields=FIELDS_STRING_HERE&sortByName=SORT_BY_NAME_STRING_HERE + the headers

      • updateUser

        @PUT(value="/apiv1/user/{userId}")
retrofit2.Call<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?>> updateUser(@Header(value="AuthToken")
                                                                                                 java.lang.String authToken,
                                                                                                 @Path(value="userId")
                                                                                                 java.lang.String userId,
                                                                                                 @Body
                                                                                                 TESTINGPOJO2 userObject)
        This would be a sample of a PUT request to a sample get user endpoint that takes in a path string attached to the user id as well as a user object (TESTINGPOJO2 object) and returns a map of type String, ?. An example return here would be something like: {"deleted" : "successful", "info" {"deletedOn" : "2016-09-01", "deletedVia" : "mobile"}}
        Parameters:
        authToken - Sample auth token
        userId - Sample user id
        userObject - User object of type TESTINGPOJO2 to update the user details. Maybe changing their name or some other portion of their object
        Returns:
        Return an object of type TESTINGPOJO2 (See above for sample printed return) This url request would look like this if printed out: www.baseurl.com/api/v1/user/USER_ID_HERE + the headers + JSON Body

      • deleteUser

        @DELETE(value="/apiv1/user/{userId}")
retrofit2.Call<java.lang.Void> deleteUser(@Header(value="AuthToken")
                                                                                 java.lang.String authToken,
                                                                                 @Path(value="userId")
                                                                                 java.lang.String userId)
        This would be a sample of a DELETE request to remove a user from the DB. The data sent would be the auth token and their user ID to delete.
        Parameters:
        authToken - Sample auth token
        userId - Sample user id
        Returns:
        Returns nothing, so void. In this case, just check for an error response This url request would look like this if printed out: www.baseurl.com/api/v1/user/USER_ID_HERE + the headers
